result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke D Bernstein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must sign up for Probation the next time he meets with his Probation Agent.
Concurrent with: Any probation currently serving.

miscConds.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

12/15/14 CORRECTED TO ERASE THE DNA SURCHARGE AS IT WAS NOT COURT ORDERED.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
09/22/2017 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS SENTENCE CREDIT BE REDUCED FROM 308 DAYS TO 0 DAYS CREDIT.
09/29/2017 CORRECTED TO READD THE 308 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT TO THIS CASE.
5/3/2019 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS SENTENCE CREDIT REFLECT 311 DAYS.
Concurrent with: 13CF157

superMiscConds.notes: Must maintain absolute sobriety. Must not possess or consume any controlled substances or mood altering substances unless prescribed by a healthcare provider.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

judgments.dispoDesc: Probation is revoked and sentence is imposed.
